fields.summary: Find a better organizational scheme for inter-language integration / protocol tests and integration tests between Apache Arrow and third party projects

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

worklogs.comment:
xhochy commented on pull request #6568: ARROW-5265: [Python/CI] Add integration test with kartothek
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6568
 
 
   Kartothek broke again with the latest Arrow release (e.g. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8057) thus I finally took the time and wrote the integration test. This will be failing until we have a workaround implement in kartothek for ARROW-8057.
   
   cc @fjetter

kszucs commented on pull request #6568: ARROW-5265: [Python/CI] Add integration test with kartothek
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6568#discussion_r390440855
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/docker/conda-python-kartothek.dockerfile
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+ARG repo
+ARG arch=amd64
+ARG python=3.6
+FROM ${repo}:${arch}-conda-python-${python}
+
+# install kartothek dependencies from conda-forge
+RUN conda install -c conda-forge -q \
+        decorator \
+        pytest-xdist \
+        dask \
+        msgpack-python \
+        simplejson \
+        simplekv \
+        storefact \
+        toolz \
+        urlquote \
+        zstandard && \
+    conda clean --all
+
+ARG kartothek=latest
+COPY ci/scripts/install_kartothek.sh /arrow/ci/scripts/
+RUN /arrow/ci/scripts/install_kartothek.sh ${kartothek} /kartothek
+
 
 Review comment:
   Newline.

kszucs commented on issue #6568: ARROW-5265: [Python/CI] Add integration test with kartothek
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6568#issuecomment-597177918
 
 
   We don't have mailing list-level visibility of GitHub Actions cron jobs, when these the watchers or members (I'm not sure, depending on individuals' notification settings) get emails with subject like:
   
   ```
   [apache/arrow] Run failed: Python Cron - master (fe71388)
   ```
   
   Github actions now has an API so we an collect these errors, but the quickest solution would be to move these cron jobs to crossbow for now.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on issue #6568: ARROW-5265: [Python/CI] Add integration test with kartothek
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6568#issuecomment-597220048
 
 
   We could make the crossbow email job also query the GHA nightly build status. I hadn't seen that they'd added an API for that, which would be nice, but even without a proper API, we could find a way. One lame workaround that occurred to me was that we could fetch the public badge SVG and grep for "failure".

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: https://github.com/JDASoftwareGroup/kartothek is a heavy user of Apache Arrow and thus a good indicator whether we have introduced some breakages in {{pyarrow}}. Thus we should run regular integration tests against it as we do with other libraries.

comments.body: It seems that is enabled on the Karkothek CI. Is it useful to add it to the Arrow CI as well?
